result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah M Halase was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS AND DNA. PAID IN FULL.
Maintain full time employment and or/school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and other Drug Assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment.
Defendant may file a petition for expungement at the end of her sentence.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Not to use or possess any drugs without a valid doctor's prescription.
All doctor's prescriptions to be verified by Probation/Parole Agent.
Defendant to notify any physician of her conviction.
Submit to random drug screens.
No contact with Roberto G. or Manuel D.
No contact with any Walgreen's pharmacy.
Any counseling deemed appropriate by the Probation agent.
Any unspecified amount of community service in which she is involved in programs targeting teens regarding the dangers of opiate addictions.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Case 14CF228 was dismissed and read into: 14CF1053.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - nonoworking hours - STAYED to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sarah M Halase in court with attorney David John Molter.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 is dismissed and read-in. Court orders the Defense Memorandum to be sealed. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  Sentence withheld for 3 years Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - APPLY BAIL FROM 14CF228 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - APPLY BAIL FROM 14CF228
- Conditions of  Probation: An Alcohol and other drug assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription. All doctor's prescriptions are to be verified with probation and parole. Defendant is to notify any physician that she has this conviction. Random Drug screens. No contact with Roberto G. or Manuel D.. No contact with any Walgreens pharmacy. Any counseling deemed appropriate by the probation department. Full time employment or school, or combination thereof. Any unspecified amount of community service in which she is involved in programs targeting teens regarding the dangers of opiate additions.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
- 60 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion


Defense reserves right to expungement
Court states the defendant should have expungement - defendant to file a petition at the end of her sentence.
Sentencing Memorandum, filed with a treatment letter and a community service letter.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant to have no contact with any co-actor, business (Walgreens) listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Sarah M Halase in court with attorney David John Molter.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
  Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
